I sighed. Well, I wanted to make a difference. Let's get to work, I thought. I grabbed my coat and followed the man to the car. Once I was buckled in, I asked, "So, what's my job?" 

The man said nothing. He just started the car and drove away.

"I didn't bring a lunch or anything. Will there be a cafeteria there? At work?" I asked.

Again, the man said nothing. 



The man drove for hours. We were in the middle of nowhere. Finally, we arrived at a building. The man led me inside and we walked down a long hallway.

When you're 28, science discovers a drug that stops all effects of aging, creating immortality. Your government decides to give the drug to all citizens under 26, but you and the rest of the "Lost Generations" are deemed too high-risk. When you're 85, the side effects are finally discovered. You're given the choice of taking the drug or dying. If you take the drug, there is still a chance of dying due to old age.   If you don't, you'll die anyway. You decide to take the drug. 

One week after taking the drug, I have survived. I have been given a second chance at life. I have been given a second chance to make the world a better place.
